KPU Usulkan Larangan Calon Eks Napi Koruptor Masuk PKPU Pilkada
04 Nov 2019, 08:02 by Dewi Nurita, Endri Kurniawati
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Ketua Komisi Pemilihan Umum (KPU) Arief Budiman mengusulkan aturan tentang larangan kepala daerah eks napi koruptor masuk ke dalam peraturan KPU (PKPU) tentang Pencalonan dalam Pemilihan Kepala Daerah 2020. "Kalau larangan caleg eks napi koruptor kan memang sudah dibatalkan oleh MA lewat judicial review. Ke depan, kami ingin ini diatur dalam Pilkada," kata Arief seusai rapat dengar pendapat dengan Komisi II DPR RI di Kompleks DPR RI, Jakarta, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Mengantisipasi aturan ini digugat lagi ke MA, KPU meminta UU Pemilu direvisi terlebih dahulu. "Semua pihak kalau saya lihat komentarnya, sepanjang ini diatur di dalam undang-undang maka bisa menerima," ujar Arief.
Pada pemilihan legislatif 2019, KPU membuat PKPU yang melarang eks caleg napi koruptor ikut pemilu. PKPU digugat ke Mahkamah Agung (MA) karena dianggap bertentangan dengan peraturan di atasnya. Oleh MA, peraturan itu dibatalkan dan caleg eks napi koruptor boleh mencalonkan diri.
Arief mengatakan, KPU bersikukuh menerapkan aturan ini demi menghasilkan pemimpin yang terbaik untuk masyarakat. Kepala daerah hanya satu orang, dan menjadi figur yang bisa memberi contoh kepada masyarakat yang dipimpinnya. â€œMaka harus kita cari betul-betul yang sangat baik, dalam tanda kutip dia harus sosok yang sempurna."

KPU Proposes Prohibition of Ex-Corruption Corruption Candidates Enter PKPU in Local Election
04 Nov 2019, 08:02 by Dewi Nurita, Endri Kurniawati
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Chairperson of the General Election Commission (KPU) Arief Budiman proposes the rules on the prohibition of ex-corrupt regional prisoners from entering into KPU regulations (PKPU) concerning Nominations in the 2020 Regional Election. " canceled by the Supreme Court through a judicial review. Going forward, we want this to be regulated in the elections, "Arief said after a hearing with the House of Representatives Commission II at the Indonesian Parliament Complex, Jakarta, Monday, November 4, 2019.
Anticipating this rule to be sued again by the Supreme Court, the KPU requests that the Election Law be revised first. "All parties, if I look at their comments, as long as this is regulated in the law, they can accept it," Arief said.
In the 2019 legislative election, the KPU created a PKPU that prohibits ex-corrupt prisoner candidates from participating in the elections. PKPU was sued by the Supreme Court (MA) because it was considered to be in conflict with the regulations above it. By the Supreme Court, the regulation was canceled and candidates for ex-corrupt prisoners were allowed to run.
Arief said, the Commission was determined to apply this rule in order to produce the best leaders for the community. The head of the region is only one person, and is a figure who can give an example to the people he leads. "Then we have to look really well, in quotes he must be the perfect figure."
